name: weed control, by brush cutter, pasture | weed control, by brush cutter, pasture | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20800/documentation

This dataset represents an example of a typical  mechanical weed control, by brush cutter. The functional unit (FU) is one ha. The operation time is 0.3 h/FU and the fuel consumption is 17.0 liters per hour.;This is a common operation in pasture cultivation in Brazil.

From agricultural field foreseen to be processed.

The dataset includes the diesel fuel consumption and the amount of agricultural machinery and of the shed, which has to be attributed to the mechanical weed control. Also taken into consideration is the amount of emissions to the air from combustion and the emission to the soil from tyre abrasion during the work process. The dataset doesn't include the dust other than from combustion and noise. This activity ends with weed control, transfer back to the shed and uncoupling of the implement from the tractor.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0162:Support activities for animal production

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Most of the data used to modelling this activity were collected in the last few years (2012-2016).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for farming processes in Brazil.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology about weed control operation during pasture production.;This activity is performed with a tractor (power 80 hp; weight 3740 kg) and a brush cutter (weight 800 kg). Life spam of the tractor is considered as 6000 hours and of the implement as 2500 hours. Machinery used, fuel consumption and operation efficiencies were based on expert's informations and unpublished data.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Values given in the reference are representative for the chosen work processes. Processes are typical procedures for Brazil around the year 2016,  they are not statistical average processes.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The main source of data for the inputs are projects conducted by Embrapa Pantanal (CPAP) and Embrapa Gado de Corte (CNPGC). Data are also provided by relevant experts related to agricultural sector in Brazil. 
Emissions from burning of fossil fuels are estimated according to Nemecek and Kagi (2007).
